sentences.sentence: The Israeli military rescued two hostages in Rafah in an operation that has left dozens of Palestinians dead.

sentences.sentence: Elon Musk has denied Ukrainian claims his company's Starlink terminals are being sold to Russia's military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Nearly half of the world's migratory species are in decline, largely due to human impact, according to a UN study.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Costa Rica is drowning in narcoactivity and wants the EU to help in the fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The Israeli military rescued two hostages in Rafah in an operation that has left dozens of Palestinians dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Both were airlifted to Sheva Hospital and were reported to be in good medical condition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They have been identified as 60-year-old Fernando Simon Marmon and 70-year-old Luis Ha, who were kidnapped by Hamas militants in the 7th of October cross-border attack that triggered the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: From the moment the explosion of the fire hit the apartment, the soldiers of the Yaman were beaten and defended with their bodies by Luis and Fernando.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: A fierce battle began and heavy firefights were launched, with several people trapped in a trench by many terrorists." At least 67 Palestinians were killed in airstrikes that were part of the raid, according to Palestinian hospital officials, among them women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Several others were wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The Israeli attacks left a path of destruction in Rafah, a designated safe zone where 1.4 million of Gaza's displaced sought refuge. The attacks come a few hours after President Joe Biden warned Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that Israel should not conduct a military operation against Hamas in Rafah without a credible and executable plan to protect civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: SpaceX founder Elon Musk has denied that his company is selling its Starlink terminals

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's military service said on Sunday that attacking Russian forces had been found using the terminals to aid their attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It released what it said was a recording of an intercepted conversation between two Russian soldiers as proof.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Russia also denied the claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Starlink terminals use a series of satellites run by Elon Musk's company SpaceX to provide high-speed communications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They have been vital in giving Ukraine's military an edge over invading Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The U.S. Senate voted on Sunday to advance a foreign aid bill that, if approved, could mean billions of dollars of much-needed support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The motion is agreed to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Russian forces appear to have constructed a 30-kilometer-long barrier

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: dubbed the Tsar Train in occupied Donetsk region, possibly to serve as a defensive line against future Ukrainian assaults the Institute for the study of war says satellite imagery dated on the 10th of May 2023 and then the 6th and the 10th of February 2024 shows that Russian forces constructed a long line of train cars stretching from occupied Olenivka, south of Donetsk city, to Volnovaha, southeast of Vuhledar and north of Mariupol over the past nine months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A Ukrainian open-source intelligence interactive online map of the military operations deep state reported on the 11th of february that russian forces have assembled more than 2 100 freight cars into a 30 kilometer long train the source reported that russian forces began assembling the train in july 2023 and suggested that russian forces intend to use the train as a defensive line against future ukrainian assaults the railway line between Olenivka and Volnovakha is roughly six kilometers from the Institute for the Study of War's current assessed front line southeast of Novomykhailivka at its closest point and is in the area of the front that was relatively inactive when Russian forces reportedly began construction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Russian forces have recently made marginal territorial gains in this area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Institute for the Study of War says the Russians could have assembled the train for other purposes as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Close to half of the world's migratory animals are in drastic decline due to factors including

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: humanity's impact on their habitats and climate change. That's the alarming conclusion of a new UN study of 1,200 species around the world. It says 44% of them are in decline and around a fifth of those are threatened with extinction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: These species live in habitats where the habitats are very important in terms of providing us with clean water, clean air, food, coastal and other literal protection and so on. And the habitats can't provide these ecosystem services if we don't look after the animals that are part of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Forests aren't just about trees. Wetlands aren't just about reeds and grasses, it's very much about the whole ecosystem and the animals that live in them and migratory species are part of all of these ecosystems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Delegates at a UN conference on the crisis agreed to evaluate proposals for targeted conservation measures to be taken by international authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The report's authors stress that because migration is a transnational phenomenon, only coordinated action by world governments can save some species.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Costa Rica is drowning in narco activity and wants the EU to help in the fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Cocaine and fentanyl have already swamped the outskirts of the country's capital, where police are hunting for gang leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The tropical paradise is on the brink of collapse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are in Pavas, one of Costa Rica's most important drug-related organizations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If they were to be armed or drugged, we would immediately proceed with arrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We're in Pavas, one of Costa Rica's most dangerous drug districts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Almost every day, police come here searching for cartel bosses that are suspected to hide in these buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What's happening to Costa Rica?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Is the popular tourist destination slowly turning into a narco state?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Last year, gang warfare over territories saw Costa Rica's murder rate soaring by 40 percent to a record high. Having abolished its army 70 years ago, the peaceful country has little means to suppress the violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We were not prepared to face such violent drug trafficking that kills so many people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There is a big difference between the resources that the police have and the great resources that drug trafficking has today. Costa Rica and the European Union los recursos con los que cuenta la policía, con los grandes recursos que cuenta hoy el narcotráfico.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Costa Rica y la Unión Europea ahora quieren cooperar más cerca en temas de seguridad, pero la intervención en Centroamérica podría también reducir la cantidad recordada de cocaína en Europa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Estamos listos para ayudar también en términos de compartir buenas prácticas y lo que está siendo hecho en Europa. sharing good practices and what is being done in Europe. So there will be experts which will help on the port authorities, on the police side, and also on the legal aspect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Costa Rican police continue to search for the gang leaders in Pavas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The government plans to increase the number of police officers by 10 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Too late, according to many, who fear the country will fall under narco-control within just months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Johannes Blechberger, Euronews, Pavas, Costa Rica.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Solar panel manufacturers in Europe say the sector is facing an existential challenge from heavily subsidized Chinese competitors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: According to insiders, Chinese solar panel manufacturers have a near monopoly on the sector, and if no measures are taken, Europe's industry could collapse within months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: European manufacturers have asked the European Commission for emergency aid, including the purchase of accumulated stock to provide liquidity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So China has been subsidizing their industry for more than a decade. They took a strategic decision for more than like 15 years ago that they saw PV as a strategic technology. They años atrás, que vieron a PV como una tecnología estratégica. Hicieron así en otras áreas, como vehículos eléctricos y baterías, etc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Precios más bajos en otros países han hecho que varias compañías deciden relocarse fuera del continente, mientras que otros han hecho que los trabajadores sean redundantes. staff redundant. To fight against the fierce competition of China and avoid falling into the broken bank, factories like these, Solarge, in the Netherlands, have had to adapt and innovate much more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For example, creating this solar panel, which is much lighter than the usual ones and can be installed on roofs that do not support the weight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But even for those innovators, the situation could soon become untenable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: If it takes one or two years, a lot of companies, also us, we will see some impact, definitely, with having to go down with price levels and being less competitive and profitable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Chinese competition not only endangers companies, but also could affect Europe's industrial independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: A module produced in China is about 50% cheaper than one made in Europe. Meanwhile, European producers account for only 3% of the EU market. In the medium term, the EU has two directives almost finalized that could reduce competition. The first would require 40% of the clean technologies installed in the EU to be manufactured here as well. The second would prohibit the sale in the EU of products made with forced labor, something that happens in several areas of China. The European Commission has not yet announced any emergency measures and is still assessing the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It's important that the solar market in Europe keeps growing because we're still not at the levels that we need to reach the 2030 targets. So any industrial strategy for the manufacturing needs to make sure that it doesn't impact negatively the continued growth of the European solar markets. Striking the right balance is essential for the EU. Solar energy is one of the cheapest and easiest to install, so rapid deployment could make a difference in meeting climate targets. By 2030, 42.5% of all EU energy will have to come from renewable sources.
